Package edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final.beings

Class LivingBeing

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final.beings.LivingBeing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ninja, Player
    public abstract class LivingBeing
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is the LivingBeing class. This class is a super class and an abstract class. It passes on attributes to the Player and Ninja subclasses. No instances can be made from this class, therefore the subclasses inherit this classes methods.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LivingBeing

        public LivingBeing​(int x,
                   int y)
        This is the constructor for the LivingBeing abstract class. It's parameter is a position on the grid. When the constructor is called, it will take in the parameter of the position and created the living being on that position on the grid. The constructor essentially spawns the living being when it is called on.
        Parameters:
        x - the x position on the grid to create the LivingBeing
        y - the y position on the grid to create the LivingBeing

    • Method Detail

      • getPositionX

        public int getPositionX()
        This is the getPostion method. Its job is to return the position of the living being back to the User Interface class so that it can display the information to the user
        Returns:
        the x position, or row, of the LivingBeing

      • getPositionY

        public int getPositionY()
        Getter for y coordinate, or column
        Returns:
        the y position, or column, of the LivingBeing

      • setX

        public void setX​(int x)
        Setter for x coordinate, or row
        Parameters:
        x - the int value of the x position, or row, of the LivingBeing

      • setY

        public void setY​(int y)
        Setter for y coordinate, or column
        Parameters:
        y - the int value of the y position, or column, of the LivingBeing

      • move

        public void move​(int direction)
        This is the move class. It receives a parameter, direction, and passes it on to the subclasses and tells them when to move.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction to move the LivingBeing. If it is 0, the being moves up. If 1, the being moves down. If 2, the being moves left. If 3, the being moves right
